medi:segment.name: Beginning of message
medi:segment.medi:documentation: BGM, A segment for unique identification of the Delivery schedule message by means of its name and its number and its function (original, replacement, change).

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, The DTM segment shall be specified at least once to identify the Delivery schedule message date. This segment can be included to indicate the beginning and the end date of the schedule.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification when required. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 1: A group of segments giving references relevant to the whole message, e.g. contract number.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for giving references to the whole Delivery schedule message, e.g. contract, original message number (AGO), previous message number (ACW), import or export licence.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date or time, or date and time of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 2: A group of segments identifying parties by their names, addresses, locations, references and contacts relevant to the whole selivery schedule.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses and their functions relevant for the whole Delivery schedule. The principal parties for the Delivery schedule message shall be identified. The identification of the recipient of the goods must be given in the NAD segment in the detail section. It is recommended that where possible only the coded form of the party ID should be specified.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 3: A group of segments giving references relevant to the party.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment giving references related to the party.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 4: A group of segments to identify person, function, or department and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, or department to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment identifying communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in the CTA segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 5: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date/time/period relating to the whole message. This group of segments is used only when the requested mode and means of transport deviates from the norm.

medi:segment.name: Details of transport
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the TDT segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 6: A group of segments providing details on delivery points and products and related information using one of both scheduling methods (as described in 1.3 Principles).

medi:segment.name: General indicator
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIS, A segment to indicate which method is used by the relevant processing indicator code.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 7: A group of segments needed to identify a delivery point and its attached information when the delivery point method is used.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying the consignee.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location at the consignee address (e.g. dock, gate,..) to which product, as specified in the LIN-Segment groups, should be delivered.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification when required. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 8: A group of segments giving references relevant to the consignee.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment giving references related to the consignee.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 9: A group of segments providing information relating to documents required for the consignee.

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DOC, A segment describing the documents required for the specified consignee.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of documents required.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 10: A group of segments to identify a person, function or department at the consignee and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, or department to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, Communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in CTA segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 11: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date and/or time of departure and destination relating to specified delivery point. This group of segments is used only when the requested mode and means of transport deviates from the norm.

medi:segment.name: Details of transport
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details of departure or arrival relating to the TDT segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 12: SG13-SG14-SG15-SG17-SG20-SG22 A group of segments providing details of the individual line items for both methods.

medi:segment.name: Line item
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LIN, A segment identifying the details of the product or service to be delivered, e.g. product identification. All other segments in the detail section following the LIN segment refer to the line item.

medi:segment.name: Additional product id
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PIA, A segment providing additional product identification.

medi:segment.name: Item description
medi:segment.medi:documentation: IMD, A segment for describing the product or the service to be delivered. This segment should be used for products that cannot be identified by a product code or article number.

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of the item to be delivered in original or unpacked form.

medi:segment.name: Additional information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: ALI, A segment indicating that the line item is subject to special conditions due to origin, customs preference, or commercial factors.

medi:segment.name: Goods identity number
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the goods to be delivered, e.g. serial numbers.

medi:segment.name: Related identification numbers
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIR, A segment providing sets of related identification numbers for a line item, e.g. engine number, chassis number and transmission number for a vehicle.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location to which products, as specified in the LIN-Segment group, should be placed after delivery. This function should only be used with the delivery point driven method.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period associated with the line item, such as the date of the engineering change.

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification, when required, to the line item to be delivered. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 13: A group of segments giving references related to the line item and where necessary, their dates.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying references to the line item, e.g. a contract and its appropriate line item, original message number, previous message number if different per line item.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 14: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date/time/period related to the specified transport details. When using the delivery point method this segment group overrides for the product identified in the LIN segment the information specified in segment group 11 .

medi:segment.name: Details of transport
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods for the specified location.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the TDT segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 15: A group of segments specifying product quantities and associated dates not related to schedules and where relevant, references.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities not related to schedule(s) e.g. cumulative quantity, last quantity considered.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the quantity.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 16: A group of segments giving references related to the quantity and where necessary, their date.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying reference to the quantity, e.g. despatch advice number.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 17: A group of segments specifying the schedule information for the product identified in the LIN segment. With the delivery point driven methd this segment group provides the schedule for the identified delivery point and product. With the product driven method this segment group can be used to summarise all schedules provided with the subsequent delivery point information given in segment group 22.

medi:segment.name: Scheduling conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the status of the schedule. Optionally a delivery pattern can be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery pattern.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 18: A group of segments specifying product quantities and associated dates.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify scheduled quantities which may be related to schedule(s) and, or pattern established in the following DTM segment, e.g. delivery quantity for a specified date.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating date/time/period details relating to the given quantity.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 19: A group of segments for specifying references associated with the given schedule's quantity and date and where necessary the reference dates.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to provide reference for the given schedule's quantity and date.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 20: A group of segments identifying the packaging, physical dimensions, and marks and numbers for goods referenced in the line item to be delivered.

medi:segment.name: Package
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PAC, A segment specifying the number of package units and the type of packaging for the line item, e.g. pallet.

medi:segment.name: Measurements
medi:segment.medi:documentation: MEA, A segment specifying physical measurements of packages described in the PAC segment, e.g. pallet dimensions.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities relating to the physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment specifying date/time/period details relating to the physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment, e.g. packaging specification date.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 21: A group of segments identifying markings and labels and if relevant package numbers.

medi:segment.name: Package identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: PCI, A segment specifying markings and labels used on individual physical units (packages) described in the PAC segment.

medi:segment.name: Goods identity number
medi:segment.medi:documentation: GIN, A segment providing identity numbers to be applied to the packages to be delivered.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 22: A group of segments providing details of the individual delivery points for the given product.

medi:segment.name: Name and address
medi:segment.medi:documentation: NAD, A segment for identifying names and addresses relevant to the delivery point.

medi:segment.name: Place/location identification
medi:segment.medi:documentation: LOC, A segment identifying a specific location at the address (e.g. dock, gate,..).

medi:segment.name: Free text
medi:segment.medi:documentation: FTX, A segment with free text in coded or clear form to give further clarification when required. In computer to computer exchanges such text will normally require the receiver to process this segment manually.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 23: A group of segments providing information relating to documents required for the delivery point.

medi:segment.name: Document/message details
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DOC, A segment providing information relating to the documents required for specified delivery points.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of documents required.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 24: A group of segments to identify a person, function or department and appropriate numbers to whom communication should be directed. The information specified in this group is related to the delivery point.

medi:segment.name: Contact information
medi:segment.medi:documentation: CTA, A segment to identify the person, function, or department to whom communication should be directed.

medi:segment.name: Communication contact
medi:segment.medi:documentation: COM, A segment to identify communication types and numbers for the person, function, or department identified in CTA segment.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 25: A group of segments specifying product quantities and associated dates and where relevant, references relating to the delivery point.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities not related to schedule(s) e.g. cumulative quantity, last quantity considered.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the given quantity.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 26: A group of segments giving references related to the quantity and where necessary, their dates.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment for identifying references to the quantity, e.g. despatch advice number.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 27: A group of segments specifying scheduling information detailing quantities and date for the given delivery point. This segment group also specifies references and their associated dates related to the schedule as required for the delivery point.

medi:segment.name: Scheduling conditions
medi:segment.medi:documentation: SCC, A segment specifying the status of the schedule. Optionally a delivery pattern can be established, e.g. firm or proposed delivery schedule for a weekly pattern.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 28: A group of segments specifying product quantities and associated dates.

medi:segment.name: Quantity
medi:segment.medi:documentation: QTY, A segment to specify pertinent quantities which may relate to schedule(s) and/or pattern established in the SCC segment, e.g. delivery quantity for a specified date.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period details relating to the given quantity.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 29: A group of segments for specifying references associated with the given schedule and delivery point and where necessary their dates.

medi:segment.name: Reference
medi:segment.medi:documentation: RFF, A segment to provide references for the given schedules and dates.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, Date/time/period of the reference.

medi:segmentGroup.medi:documentation: Segment group 30: A group of segments specifying details of the mode and means of transport, and date/time/period relating to the delivery point. This segment's information overrides transport detail information for the identified delivery point given in segment group 5 or segment group 14.

medi:segment.name: Details of transport
medi:segment.medi:documentation: TDT, A segment specifying the carriage, and the mode and means of transport of the goods for the delivery point.

medi:segment.name: Date/time/period
medi:segment.medi:documentation: DTM, A segment indicating the date/time/period relating to the TDT segment.
